For Good".This is where you come in!What is a Mirrogram?A Mirrogram is a design that changes in the mirror to say something different, make a statement and create conversation.Are you clever enough to work out the ones below? Shoot us a comment with your answers.Generosi-teeThese clothes don't just change in the mirror. They change lives.Generosi-tee is the only response you can have after many trips to India and Nepal. This is not a token gesture. I am not even waiting until we've made a profit. There are people in desperate need and your choice to support Mirrogram will help at least some of them out. The best thing is you get to choose the project you are most passionate about (midday meal, school supplies, opportunity and talks/workshops). Your selection empowers locals to work in their own communities, which I am convinced is the most effective way of aiding development.What you get? (AKA: The Perks)
To create conversation.
To challenge assumptions and cause others to "Stop and Reflect".
To become a billboard for something that matters to you.
A great excuse if you get caught checking yourself out in the mirror.
Unique hand-made designs that say something different when reflected.
To help change the lives of some of the world's poorest people.
A great way to play a prank on one of your friends.
These completely unique designs are available on Premium quality Caps and Shirts, deliciously warm hoodies and the never seen before "Neck-Brace-Ring". We give you all you need to make a Necklace, Bracelet and Keyring and you get to choose what to make...speaking of choose, with every single one of these perks you get the choice of which development project to put $3 toward.
How else can I get involved?
Aside from taking advantage of the wonderful perks on offer you can help change fashion for good by sharing this on social media (it's as easy as clicking a button).As I said in the film, running a social enterprise solo is tough work. I've become a writer, photographer, web designer, marketer, salesman, delivery driver, heck, I've even learnt to tie bracelets! We are currently looking for collaborators so if "changing fashion for good" is something you'd like to be a part of feel free to get in touch. Send an email to andrew@ontheflipside.org Frequently Asked QuestionsHow do I choose my size, colour and design? At the end of the campaign we will email you a form where you can choose your size, colour and design.Will they shrink? No, all garments are pre-shrunk except the Australian made Organic shirts which will shrink around 1/2cm (1/5 in)What will be done with the funds raised? Once we reach our goal we'll create your products and get them out to you as soon as possible. You'll also be sent a link where you can select which development project to send your $3 to. Once we have taken care of that, any additional funds will be used for continued production and expansion of our line. My hope is to be competitive enough to get into a retail chain or if things go really well, start a bricks and mortar store. Then we can really start changing fashion for good.When do I get my stuff? Allowing 20 days to receive the funds we raised we can expect to have your order delivered to you within 3 months of the end of the campaign. Most orders will come a lot sooner than that.What sizes do they come in? From Kids sizes to 5XL. I'm pretty sure we've got you covered.What if I'm not satisfied? If for any reason you're not satisfied with your perk send an email to andrew@ontheflipside.org and we'll arrange for an exchange or full return. If you've worn any clothing our only request is that you wash it before sending it back. We don't want any smelly bacteria breeding on the way back to Australia. We have strict customs laws you know!! What if someone steals my clothes? It's more a matter of when. Significant others, friends, even your kids will volunteer to do the washing for the chance at snatching your Mirrogram clothing. To combat this we suggest either getting them their own or getting hold of the Legend-Loser, Cool-Dork or Cute-Ugly designs. The next time your culprit looks in the mirror they'll get a nice surprise!

story:
Who is D'Ira

Hello my name is Brian D'Ira McDowell and I have been in the clothing industry since 2003.  I came into this industry with very little knowledge, so I studied the ends and outs of the fashion industry. After few years of learning the business and taking fashion classes, I produced 2 lines, having success with both lines. I have learned so much over the years and  I continue to grow as a designer. Now in my 3rd collection I am looking forward to seeing your reaction to my latest ideals.

I started this journey in Jackson, MS, where I was born and raised. Growing up in the south set the tone for being a well groomed man. I come from a big family and the man that I am today wouldn't be possible without them. Having  uncles, who raised me into being a well groomed young man and grandfather who raised them the same.  My name D'Ira is derived from both of my grandfathers Ira my dad's father and David my mom's father(grandfather Ira, sitting). The morals I developed growing up were to always respect your elders and family is everything. I carry those same morals in my every day life and day to day business.

With the funds I raise from this campaign I am planning to produce my 2014 collection, and your contributions will allow me to do so. The ultimate goal is to be able to give my ideas back to people and allow them to actually wear the clothes. I love to design and I love to see people in my designs and that's what you can help me accomplish. Your contributions will allow us to produce multiples in all sizes from S-XXL.

How does your contributions help

The $40,000 we need to raise will allow us to do so much. First off it will help us build a website. I would like to continue bring fresh new designs to people every season and it starts right here, right now. The majority of the money will be used to produce the items you order. I definitely believe in given my contributors something for their donations, and because you pitch in early to make this dream come true, you can be the first to rock my new line. I have designed 2 crew neck sweaters you can pick from, both have the 3 signature buttons K.L.E.A.N. on the shoulder.

Sizes: S-XXL
 This collection includes 3 cardigans with signature buttons K.L.E.A.N.

Sizes: S-XXL

I designed 2 V-neck sweaters with a diamond cut stitch pattern.


Sizes: S-XXL

Lets change the game

This project is very valuable, not only to me, but the world as a whole. Growing up in the south like I mentioned before, we had a lot of tradition and today when I visit home it seems to be a lot of that missing. Young men don't seem to care about how they look, how low their pants sag, or just keeping themselves looking presentable. The long hair and low pants seem to be the trend now, and that's exactly what I am here to change. Society will have you believing that young men don't dress up anymore and that most young men are thugs with their pants low. 

When a young man goes shopping these days he has very little to choose from, because most retail malls carry 75% women retail stores. Men are left out in the cold, sort of speaking, to fend for themselves in this fashion world. What happens when a young man gets his first job out of college, he need new clothes to go work in, t-shirts and flip flops are not suitable in Corporate America or when a young man needs to dress up for a school presentation, a dinner date or just a night out on the town, can't wear Air Jordans with everything. 

Young men every where ask themselves these questions everyday with no designer in mind. Young men are flooded with the latest sneakers, expensive jeans, and t-shirts , but still don't know how to wear a tie. So many times I hear women tell me "Oh, I wish my son would dress like that" or " Oh, I like your sense of style". This is why retail malls are 75% catered to women, men don't seem to have a clue when it come to style. Its not that men don't like to look good as well, the problem is that they truly believe they are looking good. Clothes to big, shoe colors that don't match anything, and the list goes on. Young men are the number one target market to these types of stereotypes in the clothing industry, and with your help you can help me market a new brand with a timeless look.

I have already had success in the market with two previous lines, I designed back in 2008 and 2009.

Even with the success of two lines, we still only produced a small amount of products. So many people all over never got a chance to see these lines and add a piece to their closet. A successfully funded campaign will allow us to that, We will  be able to produce enough inventory and market it on our website to people all over the world.

Process ( How does all this work)

I am glad that you have read this far and still interested in my clothing line, but I guess you would like to know the ends and out of the business and how everything works. Well, I have made the process very easy and simple just as if you are going to any other retailer and buying clothes. For many months I have been in the process of developing this line, and when I say developing, I mean the whole process of what it take to get clothes manufactured.
First things first, I develop sketches and think about how I would like the line to look, the next process is me taking different measurements from all over to develop a blended body scale that can fit different body types. The different measurements is how I develop my specs and how I develop my sizes S-XXL. Everything in the market seems to be baggy and I wanted just the opposite. All of my clothes are designed to be fitted, so medium fits like a true medium and if you like to wear your clothes a little baggy order a size up. 
Once I narrow down the designs and measurements, next is to have samples made. I use all natural fabrics in my clothes, 100% cotton and wool only for this collection. All of the materials are tested and all of the colors used for dying are tested. My clothes go through every manufacture testing just like any other designer you may have purchased in the past, and you would be happy to know that we do use United States manufacturers to do a lot of our work. 


Now, I am at my final stage and that's to supply the people like you with the merchandise. The problem I face is that in order to have these ideas brought to life I have to order a minimal number from the manufacture. Its very difficult for manufactures to make orders as you go and as a designer I don't have enough time to make each sweater individual. So like most designers, once we have met our minimal number, I will send off the orders to the manufactures and because I have done all the preliminary work, such as the testing of fabrics, measurements and etc,... it will only take about 60 days to process my orders.

Risks & Challenges

The risk that I face is just like any other business and that's not having enough capital to fund the project. We have confidence that people will flock to this line just as they did in the past. Its something new so that is always a risk, but you also have the reward of saying I was one the first contributors and I was one of the first to be rocking D'Ira. So many people are  going to ask where did you get that sweater from and they will be all sold out. There is a risk in everything we do in life and this is no different than any other risk, If I don't try then there is no risk, dare to be the next great men fashion designer. I don't see this as risk, more as a challenge and I know I have the ideas to conquer every challenge and its start right here right now.

Questions

I know I left some things out and right now at this time I couldn't tell you exactly what those things are, but I would love to hear from you. If its a question or just your thoughts about my clothing line feel free to email me with all your questions or concerns and I will be sure to answer them.  And if you have questions about needing to exchange something or swapping an item out, please Email : dira360@yahoo.com

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that's fine, just please pass the word along to as many friends and post my info to as many social media sites you are active on, and if you are on Facebook: D'Ira Clothing and Instagram: Dira360

story:
Hi Everyone,

We are MNDVA.EVENTS (Chris Perez) and INVISIBLE FRIEND (Robbi Perez). A local music event production team mash-up. We put on local live music events, provide social media campaigns, promotional material development, and act as a liaison between artists and live music venues. We have been working together in this capacity since the first of the year. Robbi's background consists of working with hundereds of musicians as well as promoting hundreds of local live music shows. Chris's background consists of providing live sound services for hundreds of bands and local events. Our business relationship together goes back a few years but have both been involved with the local music scene for over 15 years.

This not-for-profit campaign is to raise funds to create a summer tee shirt design at cost. (we are not making money here guys!!) As contributors you will help inform others of our presence in the community in a fashionable manner. #swag

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need at-least $500.00 to reach our minimum goal to get our summer tee shirts pressed.
  • Perks? You get a really cool shirt and BONUS: get to express your love for MNDVA and INVISIBLE FRIEND. [TEE/TANK will include MNDVA & INVISIBLE FRIEND LOGO incorporated with the image above]  
  • NO worries. IF we don't reach our goal we will still press the shirts! Meaning if you fund the campaign perks you will get a Tank or Tee. YAY! 

The Impact

Immeasurable impact to behold. The community will notice your neat way of choosing to help the artist machine. Value: EXTREME!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Help get the word out and make some noise. Share on your FACEBOOK wall. Tell someone. Use your rotary phone. Send a text!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Pitch

My name is Kinney Lee Fields. Founder and Director of the The Don't Sag Your Pant's Non Profit Organization. On August 1st, 2014, the 18th Annual Dallas Mayor Back to School Fair will take place at Dallas Fair Park and The Don't Sag Your Pants Organization is very excited to be approved as an official vendor. We will provide free belts to students/families or individuals that need them. And we would like you to support our cause by being a part of The $3.86 Cent Campaign.
Long Pitch
Who needs a belt? Come on think about it. Look around anywhere these days. How many times you  been downtown and just notice how many people hanging around sagging their pants.  You've seen it. There are a more than few people who could benefit from a belt. And what do we do. Maybe comment to ourselves, maybe not. But what do we do? We move on. It's not us. We can't stop it. And that's perfectly ok to feel that way. And that's  why this campaign is here. The Don't Sag Your Pants Organization only goal is to provide belts. To me its not about stopping people from sagging, my agenda is only to provide the means to do so if someone decides that choice.
The Home Run
Six words. $3.86. Again, six words. THREE DOLLARS AND EIGHTY SIX CENTS. That's all it takes to be a part of this campaign. One person. One individual. Yourself. You. You there. A one time donation of $3.86. This is what it cost for my organization to provide each belt. 100 percent of your kindness goes to the purchase of one belt. The donation from you and those like you allow us to knock it out the park and make a difference in the City Of Dallas. Be a superstar and make your donation today.

story:
Ed: The Perfect Minimalist Wallet

As Featured in:

(Crowdfunding Projects Gadget Flow Backed – June 2017)

Features

Ed in Black Full Grain leather (Saffiano Finished)

Ed in Crazy Horse Leather

What is Crazy Horse Leather?

Crazy horse leather which is also called Saddleback are made by applying a layer of wax to the surface of the leather giving it an antique look. The more you use it, the better it looks.

Why Saffiano Leather?

Saffiano leather is highly durable and tough, scratch and water resistance. 

Our Story

We came up with this idea of Ed Wallet because each time we travel out of the country, we would have to select a smaller wallet. Bringing only the necessities for the trip with a smaller wallet, and the hassle of carrying loose change. 

With that in mind, we then began to develop a small sized, minimalist wallet that can be used every day for holding cards, cash and coins with ease. 

Ed had a long journey to begin with, first we began prototyping it with different type of leathers ensuring that it can overcome long term usage. Followed by getting the right dimension & feedback from user experience. Now, we are proud to say we have created something we are truly proud of. 

About Us

Ed Charly is a team of product designers based in Singapore who aim to create meaningful minimalist products to suits your everyday needs.

Ed is designed to make your everyday carry easier and more convenient and we hope that you can help us to bring Ed to the world.

Timeline

If everything goes as planned below, Ed will be delivered during November, enough time before the Holiday Seasons for you to plan the perfect gift for your loved ones.

Social Media & Press Kit

 

Download Our Press Kit Here

story:
HELP PATIENCE & YOURSELF BY GETTING SOME HAND CRAFTED BEADED GOODS FROM GHANA 

 

What is Pangea Empowerment?

  • Pangea: The hypothetical landmass that existed when all continents were joined
  • Empowerment: To enable

These two words combined together symbolize for our team the ability to connect, regardless of geographical location, and enable entrepreneurs from all walks of life in achieving their personal and professional potential. 

The genesis of Pangea Empowerment was born on the beautiful North Shores of Laie, Hawaii, where the campus of Brigham Young University - Hawaii (BYU-Hawaii) is located. It was here where a group of dedicated university students and their entrepreneurship professor were invited to teach crowdfunding in Congo, Africa.

Excited as the group was by the invitation, they knew crowdfunding in Africa had serious challenges. To research these challenges they partnered up with Patience, a Ghanaian entrepreneur, and launched this IndieGoGo campaign for her beaded jewelry company.  

From the crowdfunding campaign in Ghana to the crowdfunding conference in Congo an idea began to form. All across the world entrepreneurs are diligently working to come up with new ideas, create new products, and build a legacy for the next up and coming generation. In some areas though, issues such as poverty, hunger, crime, war, and violence impede the entrepreneurship dream. These hampered aspirations could do so much more if entrepreneurs had access to the right tools and opportunities.

Pangea Empowerment's purpose is to fuel the creativity and dreams of entrepreneurs everywhere, but particularly in locations where access to funding and specific technology is severely limited. To accomplish this goal, an academic model of research and teaching is being coupled with entrepreneurial principles and application.

Who is behind Pangea Empowerment?

Hibatu Rahman Ibrahim Arkoh, a junior at BYU-Hawaii and from Ghana, is pursuing a degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management and a minor in Information Technology. Growing up, she has dreamed of helping her people in Africa and, even more specifically, Ghana. Her favorite quote is, “Helping one person might not change the world, but it could change the world for one person.” In this project, she is helping with the campaign promotion and developing crowdfunding curriculum to be taught in Africa.

 

Gabriela Porras, a senior at BYU-Hawaii and from Colorado, is majoring in Business Management with an emphasis in Marketing. After graduation she plans to pursue a career in public relations and marketing. She is passionate about empowering entrepreneurs to create positive change in their communities. Throughout this project she has lead the team through project management and helped with the research and curriculum development.

 

Spencer Weenig, a sophomore at BYU-Hawaii and from Utah, is majoring in Marketing and Communications. Spencer had previously been majoring in PreMed but recently changed his major. He has no regrets about this decisions, since it allows him to pursue his new found passion of social entrepreneurship and enables him to focus on how he can best help others.

 

 

Aaron Shields, a sophomore at BYU-Hawaii and from Utah and Southern California, is studying Business Finance and Entrepreneurship. Aaron has a deep passion in helping people, and found his calling in life when he was introduced to social entrepreneurship. There has been nothing better for him than combining his passion for entrepreneurship and improving other people's lives. Aaron works diligently on crowdfunding video creation and campaign reward development for this project.

 

Prince Owusu, a senior at BYU-Hawaii and from Ghana, is majoring in Political Science. Prince is a dedicated activist, and has a lifelong pursuit in helping others improve their quality of life through education and entrepreneurship. Prince's primary role in this project has been to work closely with Patience in developing her entrepreneurial ambitions for her beaded jewelry business. He has also been vital in providing an in depth understanding of Ghana's culture and deep societal beliefs towards commerce and entrepreneurship. He has helped the research team formulate important questions that have brought about several significant pivots in the team's academic research endeavors. 

Paul Wilson, the BYU-Hawaii faculty sponsor of Pangea Empowerment, teaches both social entrepreneurship and digital business in the Entrepreneurship Department. For the last 20 years Paul has been a digital technologist, specializing in search, content strategy, and application development. He has managed digital projects for hundreds of small businesses, and has held senior marketing positions for large corporations. Paul recently became full time faculty at BYU - Hawaii and utilizes his industry experience to help the students explore the vast potential of earning a living on the Internet.

Who is Patience? 

If you could describe Patience in two words it would be “Hard working.” One thing she learned from her role model, Berlinda Mundi, is to never give up, to accept mistakes and shortcomings, and improve for the next time. She is one that never settles with where she is at but is always striving to grow and become better. She is close with her family of 6, 2 brothers and 2 sisters that she cares deeply for. Patience learned beading from Joyce Adjimani who inspired her to start her own business with beading. She has a deep passion for crafting and beading which shows in her creations. She creates nothing but the best products so she can to satisfy herself and her customers. Her dream is to own her own beading shop to enhance peoples fashion with her beautiful beaded jewelry, to be able to teach others the art of craft, and create job opportunities for her community. When asked what she would do with the funds raised she immediately responded that she would purchase more materials to continue to work on her dream. Patience does not like to fail, that is what inspires her each day and what will make her such a successful business owner. When she does fails she accepts it and learns from her failure which any successful person would do. Currently Patience is working on her businesses skills and learning at Ghana Institute of Management and Public Administration studying accounting. Her degree will be a major benefit in running a successful small business. Patience is a dedicated worker doing everything she can to turn her passion of beading into her dream business.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk and challenge is shipping. It can be expensive and take a significant amount of time to get items shipped. We decided that we wanted to minimize these risks by allowing an extra large budget for "shipping expenses." If there is any additional money it will all go to Patience and help her continue her dream! 

Campaign Timeline 

  • Campaign Run Time: November 14th - December 13th
  • Order's Sent to Patience: December 14th
  • Assembling of Jewelry: December 13th - February  28th
  • Shipping to Hawaii: By February 28th
  • Shipping to Individual Customers: February 28th - March 14th

Cost Breakdown

Our goal is to get Patience $500.00 so that she can increase her inventory and hopefully have an opportunity to train more people in her community in her skill. Below is a summary of the overall budget.

         TOTAL GOAL: $2,875.00 

         Profit for Patience: $500.00

         Shipping: $821.00

         Cost Indiegogo 10% Fee: $287.50  

         Product Cost: $1,266.50

  • Tie: $12.15 {4-5hrs. to make}
  • Bow Tie: $ 7.73 {2hrs to make}
  • Earrings : $2.21  {30min to make}
  • Bracelet: $5.52 {1hr to make}
  • Necklace : $22.09 {2-3hrs to make}

Why should YOU help?

Way too often we don't know where the things we are purchasing are from. All of these products are hand-made by a young lady named Patience, a university student in Ghana. YOU can be a part of making her dream come true and get beautiful hand crafted pieces to show off to your friends. Please help us in supporting Patience and Pangea Empowerment.

By purchasing any of these products you are helping us empower Patience's dream. Another excellent way to help Patience is by sharing this page and telling your friends about this amazing opportunity to get handcrafted jewelry from Ghana. Thank you for all of your help! Every bit counts!
story_txt:
HELP PATIENCE & YOURSELF BY GETTING SOME HAND CRAFTED BEADED GOODS FROM GHANA 
 
What is Pangea Empowerment?



Pangea: The hypothetical landmass that existed when all continents were joined

Empowerment: To enable

These two words combined together symbolize for our team the ability to connect, regardless of geographical location, and enable entrepreneurs from all walks of life in achieving their personal and professional potential. 
The genesis of Pangea Empowerment was born on the beautiful North Shores of Laie, Hawaii, where the campus of Brigham Young University - Hawaii (BYU-Hawaii) is located. It was here where a group of dedicated university students and their entrepreneurship professor were invited to teach crowdfunding in Congo, Africa.
Excited as the group was by the invitation, they knew crowdfunding in Africa had serious challenges. To research these challenges they partnered up with Patience, a Ghanaian entrepreneur, and launched this IndieGoGo campaign for her beaded jewelry company.  
From the crowdfunding campaign in Ghana to the crowdfunding conference in Congo an idea began to form. All across the world entrepreneurs are diligently working to come up with new ideas, create new products, and build a legacy for the next up and coming generation. In some areas though, issues such as poverty, hunger, crime, war, and violence impede the entrepreneurship dream. These hampered aspirations could do so much more if entrepreneurs had access to the right tools and opportunities.
Pangea Empowerment's purpose is to fuel the creativity and dreams of entrepreneurs everywhere, but particularly in locations where access to funding and specific technology is severely limited. To accomplish this goal, an academic model of research and teaching is being coupled with entrepreneurial principles and application.
Who is behind Pangea Empowerment?
Hibatu Rahman Ibrahim Arkoh, a junior at BYU-Hawaii and from Ghana, is pursuing a degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management and a minor in Information Technology. Paul Wilson, the BYU-Hawaii faculty sponsor of Pangea Empowerment, teaches both social entrepreneurship and digital business in the Entrepreneurship Department. For the last 20 years Paul has been a digital technologist, specializing in search, content strategy, and application development. He has managed digital projects for hundreds of small businesses, and has held senior marketing positions for large corporations. Paul recently became full time faculty at BYU - Hawaii and utilizes his industry experience to help the students explore the vast potential of earning a living on the Internet.
Who is Patience? 
If you could describe Patience in two words it would be “Hard working.” One thing she learned from her role model, Berlinda Mundi, is to never give up, to accept mistakes and shortcomings, and improve for the next time. She is one that never settles with where she is at but is always striving to grow and become better. She is close with her family of 6, 2 brothers and 2 sisters that she cares deeply for. Patience learned beading from Joyce Adjimani who inspired her to start her own business with beading. She has a deep passion for crafting and beading which shows in her creations. She creates nothing but the best products so she can to satisfy herself and her customers. Her dream is to own her own beading shop to enhance peoples fashion with her beautiful beaded jewelry, to be able to teach others the art of craft, and create job opportunities for her community. When asked what she would do with the funds raised she immediately responded that she would purchase more materials to continue to work on her dream. Patience does not like to fail, that is what inspires her each day and what will make her such a successful business owner. When she does fails she accepts it and learns from her failure which any successful person would do. Currently Patience is working on her businesses skills and learning at Ghana Institute of Management and Public Administration studying accounting. Her degree will be a major benefit in running a successful small business. Patience is a dedicated worker doing everything she can to turn her passion of beading into her dream business.

story:
Haschtag greift Züge vom traditionellen Image des Cannabiskonsumenten auf und übersetzt sie in eine moderne Sprache. Hierbei bedienen wir uns bei urbanen Stilen wie Grafitti und Tattoo-Art. Im Mittelpunkt der Haschtag-Kultur steht ein positives Mindset und die Leidenschaft für den Lifestyle mit "Laid-Back"-Feeling.

 

 

 

Ob Bund der Kriminalbeamten, Strafrechtsexperten oder Ärzte; Cannabis ist längst nicht mehr das Teufelskraut welches die Konsumenten mit Psychose an die Couch fesselt.

Durch grüne Streetwear mit Mass Appeal wollen wir die Aufmerksamkeit auf den Kampf für selbstbestimmten Konsum lenken und mit dem Taboo Cannabis im Alltag brechen.

 

 

Mit dem Unterstützen dieser Kampagne hilfst du uns dabei ein modernes Bild des Cannabiskonsumenten hinaus in die Welt zu tragen und die Bewegung zu stärken. 

Haschtag ist getrieben von unserer Leidenschaft, unserem Traum vom einem Selbstbestimmten Leben und dem Wunsch nach Veränderung.

 

 

Bei Erreichen des Finanzierungsziels können wir die Entwicklungskosten der Kollektion (Designs, Shirts, Marketing und genug Gras für die langen Abende) decken. Darüber hinaus fließt das Geld in die Umsetzung unserer weiteren Vorhaben, wie zum Beispiel unseren Stand auf der Cannabis-Messe Mary Jane in Berlin.

Genau wie beim Genuss unserer Lieblingspflanze gibt es kaum Risiken. Da wir unsere Kollektion im Sommer auch auf der Mary Jane präsentieren, erfolgt die Umsetzung der Kollektion in jeden Fall. Daher können wir für die Erfüllung aller Bestellungen garantieren. Alle Produkte sind spätestens im Juni lieferbereit.

Wir sind dankbar, in einer Industrie mit einem so positiven Vibe zu arbeiten. Daher freuen wir uns sehr, unsere Bundles in Zusammenarbeit mit gleichgesinnten Unternehmen aus der Branche anzubieten. Viel Spaß beim auschecken!

 

Viele unserer Bundle-Produkte sind Special Editions, die nur im Rahmen dieser Kampagne erhältlich sind.

Folgt uns auf auf Instagram, Facebook  und checkt die Indiegogo-Updates!

story:
We’re all looking for the perfect bag. It must fit all our daily belongings, be comfortable and look great regardless of what you do during your day! When we started Bukvy we found our self always having to choose between function and looks so we often ended up with different bags for different occasions: a backpack on the bike to work, a nice laptop case for the meetings and a third bag for dinner. So, we created Bukvy.

 

 

The Bo Bardi bag

The Bo Bardi bag is made for life in constant motion, both by function and aesthetics.

This beautifully handcrafted multi-functional 5-in-1 bag and can be carried as a:
1. Backpack
2. Lap top case
3. Tote bag
4. Shoulder bag (and/or cross body)
5. Clutch
Just change the straps, fold the bag and adjust the zippers to make it fit the moment. 

Additional info
Items with silver details has a blind debossed BUKVY logo on the front 
Size: 22- 42 cm H x 30 cm W x 3-15 cm D
Straps
2 x 75 cm L x 2 cm T

Colors

 

The Shikibu Wallet bag

The Shikibu bag is a beautifully 3-in-1 Wallet bag and can be carried as a wallet or a small bag and it also includes a detachable mini-wallet, perfect for a key, some coins and cards. 

It carries all the essentials as phone, cards, a pen, lipstick and keys in place. And when on a trip it also fits your passport. At the backside of the bag is an extra pocket. 
Height: 12cm 
Length: 18cm 
Strap: the wallet bag comes with a matching and adjustable leather strap, 1,5cm x 120cm. 

Colors

 

The Bukvy way

The Bukvy team consists of the two founders Elena Ekström and Joanna Bark, Stockholm based and best friends since the age of six. We believe it is possible to change the way we consume. Our first Bukvy-mission was to create a bag that really supports women’s multi-tasking life. We wanted to design better things, but we also need to produce them in the most sustainable way.

We are proud to only work in ways that we feel good about and not to compromise. For us this means to make as little impact on the environment as possible – including people, animals and nature. Since the start our goal has been to offer a 100% organic collection, but as a small brand it is hard to find partners that are offering organic materials, great quality and reasonable pricing. This campaign is of great importance to us since it is a way to deliver an organic collection one year earlier than we would have just using our own capacity.

The minimum quantity we need to reach is 150 bags and we need your help to complement the first order together is 150 bags and we need your help to complement the first order. We never do sales, so this is a unique opportunity to get a Bukvy discount. Except for the reduced pricing you will also get continuous updates and insight in the production process and we of course answer all your questions regarding production – as always.

Imagine what a wonderful thing to know that a beautiful daily companion will arrive in August! All support means the world to us – a cheer, a share or a purchase is all highly appreciated.

 

Sustainability & Slow fashion

The leather industry is a dirty industry, dangerous kinds of chrome is being used harming people working in both tanneries and factories, polluting drinking waters and hurting the environment in many ways. 

Mass-production is a big issue today. We buy too many things that lasts for too short time. Un-sold items are thrown in landfill and non-degradable items filled with toxic stays in the land for a long time. People also get damaged in the production process by unfair work conditions, low salaries and without any rights. And the industry just keeps on producing more and more things. But there is a difference between mass production and craftsmanship.

 

Leather

All items will be made in our carefully selected studio in Portugal by beautiful organic Italian calf leather and Portuguese goat suede. This leather is tanned entirely without toxic and will get a beautiful patina over time. It is so soft we are melting and the best way to describe the scent is pure happiness.

Through treating yourself with an ethically made, high quality item you make an impact in slow fashion. A high-quality item will age beautifully and last to be worn many times.

Read more here about our thoughts on working with leather.

 

Production schedule, risks & challenges

  • April: Indiegogo launch + preparing the tannery and detail
  • May: Leather production
  • June: Leather production and bag production
  • July: Bag production and inspection
  • August: ship to backers

As Bukvy is already up and running and we will produce the items together with our established studio the risks and challenges are the same as the ones we are meeting every day and are used to handling:

  • Delays in the production. If delays would occur, we will communicate this clearly with you. Though it is very rare, especially during Summer which is not the most stressful time.
  • Shipping problems. We use DHL to get the bags to you. You will be able to trace your item when it is shipped from us to know exactly where it is and when the estimated delivery time to you is planned.

The tannery is ready to start, and we look forward to delivering all items in the beginning of August this year.

                        

 

Press contact: Elena Ekström, elena@bezbukvy.com

(Click for Press Images)

story:
Welcome to White Lyte Shoes

Hi my name is Stewart Walker, I am the owner of White Lyte Shoes. I want to take you on a Journey that will change your life forever, as it did mine. I am a former United States Marine and a former New Mexico Police Officer. During my tour of duty I was a Cryptographic Repair Technician (Repairing Digital Voice Scramblers). After my enlistment ended I worked for various companies such as Intel Corp, Northrop Grumman, Los Alamos National Labs to name a few. As a New Mexico Law Enforcement Officer I encountered numerous cases involving missing and abused children. With my experience and background in dealing with this subject White Lyte Shoes design was born in 2006.


                          


White Lyte Shoes is a Real Time Search and Rescue Unit unlike any other Bluetooth or GPS designed system on the market. Our systems are capable of tracking one or more children or adults simultaneously using a single parent unit, In real time situations.


                                                   Single Child Parent Unit
                                                       (3.7" x 2.5" x 1.0")




                                                Two Child  Parent Unit
                                                    (3.7" x 2.5" x 1.0")


Key Fob Single Child Parent Unit                       Smaller Version of the Above Units
            (2.75" x 1.3" x 0.68")                                            (3.2" x 2.0" x 0.56")


Unlike GPS systems, there are no additional monthly charges, taxes or fees and our units can be used any where ( maximum range of Approximately 150 ft ). There is no language barrier and you don't need a smart phone, computer or internet access to use our system. There are no smart phone apps or computer tracking programs which require a certain time to learn how to use it. And with a cell phone based tracking system your entire system is now dependent solely on your cell phone battery and apps. During the horrific 911 incident in New York City, these type of tracking systems did not work because cell phones did not work, and the system was over loaded. With White Lyte shoes, you just simply turn on the Parent Unit and turn on the shoe or our new TOT SPOTZ tracker and your on your way. Our system is a closed loop unit and will work even in the underground subways, garage, and buildings.

These Are Tot Spotz and There Hot! What makes these so great is that they will fit on most brands of tennis shoes or sneakers, including your child's present pair of shoes.

This is a one time purchase that you can continually use as your child grows and you can put them in most any style shoe you purchase.

                        


We strive to keep our products up-to-date and have redesigned White Lyte Shoes/Tot Spotz so that parents and caregivers can remotely turn the shoes/Tot Spotz alarm system on and off and still be able to track your child with the Parent Unit.

For instance when your child is going to school you can remotely turn of the audible and visual alarm as they are in school and turn it back on when they are with you again. 

There may be certain times when you don't want your child's shoe to go into a visual and audible alarm,but still be able to alert you that they are out of your comfort zone.. Such as in a movie theater or Museum or if he or she is sensitive to sight and sound due to Autism (ASD).



For the past two years we have tested and perfected our "Patent Pending",Sentinel Technology, which ensures the integrity of both the Parent and Child/Adult Units power source and electronic circuits as both units will constantly check each others unit and report any problems with the battery, battery power and or electronics with the use of the visual and audible alarm.

Our products are designed to intentionally malfunction if the Parent / Child Unit are submerged in a large body of water such as a pool, a river, a lake, etc.

If you child was to fall into a pool, lake or any large body of water, White Lyte will malfunction and cause the other unit to go into an alarm state with visual and audible alarm.

White Lyte Shoes / Tot Spotz is a pro-active not reactive system and is not a replacement for proper Child / Special needs adult supervision. White Lyte was designed to enhance the abilities to keep track of Children or Adults of a parent or caregiver, while they are in their  presence, in real time situations.


Here's how our systems soars above the rest......


 Our parent units comes in various sizes and shapes to include our latest addition one of a kind parent unit FOB with audible and visual alarms. We are presently working on a two child/adult simultaneous tracking unit (very small units).



As a former police officer I know that the best and readily available help in finding a missing child or adult quickly, is the public. The next time you are out shopping in a mall or any store see if you can pick out who is an off duty fireman, policeman, teacher, doctor, etc I think you get what I mean.

Our products instantly alert the Parents / caregivers and the immediate public that a child or elderly adult is in need of assistance.


Here's how it works.....

The Parent Unit and The Child Unit are continuously checking to see if they are both connected and are working properly. The flashing red LED on the parent unit and the child unit indicate all is well.

In the event your child / adult wanders off and out of range the parent unit and the child unit will instantly alarm, with a visual and audible alarm that will continue for approximately 10 hours or until your child returns back into your range, at which time both units will automatically reset.

Ok are you still with us .... Great.

Let me take you on a journey that will change your life as it did mine. Last year we were the guest of Marilyn and Arnie Weinger of Kids are 1st. They are the greatest crusaders and champions of children safety in the USA. As their guest we were invited to Stephanie's Day, which is a resource fair for families with special needs. Stephanie who has Autism is the ambassador of the event for which it is named.

During the event I personally met the families, relatives, teachers, medical personnel of various young and older children who have Autism (ASD). As I spoke to to the parents and guardians of these precious children, I could see the despair and worry in their eyes.

As we stood there listening to their stories of how they must stay vigilant and never let their children out of their sight , or they may never see them again.

Two mothers pleaded with me to sell them our units no matter what the cost. (The units at that time where set up just for Demo purposes and I could not sell her one, let alone give them these units for free which I would have gladly done if we could).

One mother told me to watch as she let go of her sons hand. He immediately started running away from her with no care or worries. She ran after him and grabbed him and brought him back to our booth and pleaded to me to sell her our product.
I told her that I would do my best to try to get this product to market quickly.

After I returned home to Albuquerque and spoke to our chief engineer Paul Castro about the events in California, I started to learn more about Autism and the behavior of wandering and elopement.

Please view this link and feel what we feel and know what we now know

Please view this link also thank so much for caring

The above link holds a special place in my heart and in my mind. While we were in California last year, I will never forget ,that as we were testing and marketing our product that later that evening the news bulletin of the demise of little Mikaela Lynch flashed on the television screen. Well although I was a Police Officer and a Marine I could not show my feelings that night as I watched the news .But knowing why we were all in California, testing, marketing this product that we made to save children's lives I broke down in tears. When I got back in Albuquerque New Mexico , I wondered if I could have moved faster and gotten this product out quicker.  I just sat in my chair, thinking of the horror and emptiness Mikaela's family must feel everyday (my prayers go out to them everyday) although I don't know them I will do everything in my power to prevent this from happening to any other family, ever again.

I know that this is a crowd funding site and yes,we want to get fully funded, but I just had to let everyone know our passion for our products and our passion to help others so that our products will do what we designed and intended them to do and that is to save the lives of our precious little ones and keep our aging loved ones safe.

The funding for our campaign is needed to help us take our prototype/ Demo version to market. We have produced over 200 units and have new circuit boards and parts coming this week to start our production campaign, but we need your help to get a better facility to house our staff and more Assemblers so that we can output higher numbers.

We are looking at and were invited to put our product in a major department store but we will need inventory to satisfy the store manager.  We were also in negotiations with a major shoe manufacturer ,but there again we need to get higher numbers in manufactured products.


Features...


White Lyte Shoes

  • Rechargeable Lithium Ion Battery
    ( Fully Charged will last Approximately 25 hours continues ... Approximately 10 hours of continues alarm mode)
  • USB Charge Port with Charging LED indicator
  • Audio Alarm is 82 db @ 2.3 KHz intermittent alarm
  • Visual is 18000mcd 30 degree Super bright LED
  • Certification - FCC, ICS, CE


Tot Spotz

  • Rechargeable Lithium Ion Battery
    ( Fully Charged will last Approximately 10 hours continues ... Approximately 4 hours of continues alarm mode)
  • USB Charge Port with LED indicator
  • Audio Alarm is 82 db @ 2.3 KHz intermittent alarm
  • Visual is 18000mcd 30 degree Super bright LED
  • Certification - FCC, ICS, CE

Handheld Units

  • Rechargeable Lithium Ion Battery
    ( Fully Charged will last Approximately 25 hours continues ... Approximately 10 hours of continues alarm mode)
  • USB Charge Port with Charging LED indicator
  • Audio Alarm is 82 db @ 2.3 KHz intermittent alarm
  • Visual is 8000mcd 30 degree Super bright LED
  • Certification - FCC, ICS, CE

FOB

  • Rechargeable Lithium Ion Battery
    ( Fully Charged will last Approximately 10 hours continues ... Approximately 4 hours of continues alarm mode)
  • USB Charge Port with Charging LED indicator
  • Audio Alarm is 82 db @ 2.3 KHz intermittent alarm
  • Visual is 8000mcd 30 degree Super bright LED
  • Certification - FCC, ICS, CE
Please Email - Questions to Whitelyteshoes@aol.com

Welcome to White Lyte Shoes
Hi my name is Stewart Walker, I
am the owner of White Lyte Shoes. I want to take you on a Journey that will
change your life forever, as it did mine. I am a former United States Marine
and a former New Mexico Police Officer. During my tour of duty I was a
Cryptographic Repair Technician (Repairing Digital Voice Scramblers). After my enlistment ended I worked for various companies such as Intel Corp, Northrop Grumman,
Los Alamos National Labs to name a few. As a New Mexico Law Enforcement Officer
I encountered numerous cases involving missing and abused children. With my
experience and background in dealing with this subject White Lyte Shoes design
was born in 2006.

                           

White Lyte Shoes is a Real Time Search and Rescue Unit unlike any
other Bluetooth or GPS designed system on the market. Our systems are capable of tracking one or more
children or adults simultaneously using a single parent unit, In real time situations.
                                                   Single Child Parent Unit                                                       (3.7" x 2.5" x 1.0")                                                Two Child  Parent Unit                                                    (3.7" x 2.5" x 1.0")Key Fob Single Child Parent Unit                       Smaller Version of the Above Units            (2.75" x 1.3" x 0.68")                                            (3.2" x 2.0" x 0.56")Unlike GPS systems, there are no additional monthly charges, taxes or fees and our units can be used
any where ( maximum range of Approximately 150 ft ). There is no language
barrier and you don't need a smart phone, computer or internet access to use our system. There are no smart phone apps or computer tracking programs which require a certain time to learn how to use it. And with a cell phone based tracking system your entire system is now dependent solely on your cell phone battery and apps. During the horrific 911 incident in New York City, these type of tracking systems did not work because cell phones did not work, and the system was over loaded. With White Lyte shoes, you just simply turn on the Parent Unit and turn on the shoe or our new TOT SPOTZ tracker and your on your way. Our system is a closed loop unit and will work even in the underground subways, garage, and buildings. 
These Are Tot Spotz and There Hot! What makes these so great is that they will fit on most brands of tennis shoes or sneakers, including your child's present pair of shoes.This is a one time purchase that you can continually use as your child grows and you can put them in most any style shoe you purchase. 
                         
We strive to keep our products up-to-date and have redesigned White Lyte Shoes/Tot Spotz so that parents and caregivers can remotely turn the shoes/Tot Spotz alarm system on and off and still be able to track your child with the Parent Unit.

story:
It All Started With A Convention And A Bag

I was in desperate need of a bag to attend my very first Supernatural Convention and I wanted to go in style. My first thought was to created something new and handy; that's when I created the first Fallen Angel.



The bag was designed after Castiel's signature trench coat, provided enough space to carry items, and had black feather wings for added flare. 

But why is this important? 

During my convention time, I was approached by numerous attendees wanting to buy the bag.

Osric Chau, shown here in the photo, was even gracious enough to wear my bag, I was also give the opportunity to show Misha Collins himself!

When the convention was over I decided to make the bag, but I also decided I was going to donate the proceeds to a wonderful organization.


Random Acts is an organization that has grown in strength and created numerous of life changing experiences; not to mention it's creator Misha Collins is the amazing person behind this. They are known for random acts of kindness, Hope 2 Hati, and Endure for kindness.

For more information click here. Random Acts


What We Need & What You Get

Now here is what we need from you, the lovely people that you are, and what you can expect from me.


UPDATE: If you ordered a bag, you will not be able to receive it until after the campaign is over. If you need it sooner then tell email me at youatemycheese@gmail.com

Thank you.

In order to meet with demand for the bags, 50% will be going towards supplies while the rest will go straight to Random Acts. If you wish to donate to just donate,  all those proceeds will go straight to random acts. If any money is unused for supplies, it too will find its' way to Random Acts as well.

I will not in any shape or form keep any of the proceeds for myself. 

We need at least raise $500, not only for those who want the bags, but also to help change the lives of many people!

I was also able to make additional items to help raise money. All of which are hand made by me. Check out the photos to see each item up close! (The Bows are made by a fellow member of FandomisaFamily  click here for more information. Ellie's Hair Accessories)


Thank you to RPphotography, another lovely friend helping me out (Thank you Robert!), for the new and improved photos!

New addition to the cause! Thank you Fangasm for donating a book to the fundraiser! I will now add one limited package to the perks list! First come first serve!

I was able to meet Lynn at Burcon. She is so sweet and kind so please send some love to her! The book is phenomenal for any Supernatural Fan. 

A message from Lynn.

 "Fangasm" is the story of two college professors who fell head over heels in love with 'Supernatural' and turned their oh-so-responsible lives upside down. They travel to conventions and go behind the scenes on the set of Supernatural to chat with both the fans and the actors, and find a place to be real in the richly creative online fan communities. If you're a passionate Supernatural fan, come along for the ride.

When you purchase your perk, please go to the comment section on this page to inform me on which bow/bag you will like. Thank you!

  • Flower Crowns (They can be made for children and Adults)
  • Supernatural Theme Bows (Sam, Dean, Castiel, Got Salt, Supernatural logo)
  • Sam Winchester Bag (You if want antlers with this one, just ask!)
  • Dean Winchester Bag
  • And a bag of your choice! (Can be from any Fandom! Limited Supply on this one!)


The Impact

When I got to learn the stories of the fans of Supernatural, their struggles, their hardships, but also saw the compassion they have for each other, I knew I had picked the right charity. You will be helping to fund a wonderful charity and get an awesome handmade bag while you are at it! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, which I totally understand, you can still help out by raising awareness. 

You can share this on other platforms such as Instagram, Twitter, or Facebook using hashtag #FandomisaFamilyBag

You can share on tumblr by reblogging the FandomisaFamily post!

Or just by word of mouth!

We can make a difference because Fandom is a Family.




Here are the some of the perks up close!

story:
My name is Rastislav Harhovsky and I work in modeling area for the last 15 years. Currently I own a modeling agency which is looking for new faces. Some models from my agency successfully work in the European market. For last few years I focus on looking for the best faces in men population, thus I would like to move in this search and show the results of my work to the whole world.

 

My project is focused on searching and following presentation of the best male models from the central and eastern Europe. With your help I would like to create a professional web presentation which would help to present the models to the world and bring them into the show business.

  

Grants from number of people will be used to create a marketing strategy and will be invested into advertisement. We will organize workshops which will present photo modeling works in the best European studios and exteriors.

 

In case you would be so kind to help me start this unique project, you can also take part in any workshop in Europe.  You will be also able to enjoy a pleasant holiday aligned to experience from this kind of show business. In case we will not achieve the requited amount, all the funds will be invested into organisation of workshop and SEO web presentation optimization.

 

We offer access to High End fashion and photographic models who originate from Eastern Europe.  We are the ones who capture the beauty of the guys in professional photography and creating business in the fashion industry.  The appearance of the models is very distinctive from a global perspective and provokes universal interest.

We do a daily update of content adding new photos and HD video. We continue to develop with your input. 

Check us out as we grow!  

 

Already now I have a powerful database of models which I can use. I also have representative offices and lots of experience. You will always entertain with us. You will become successful investor to this unique project in the whole Europe and who knows maybe you will find the ideal of your dreams.

story:
Our Story

Lindsey is an 8th grade grammar teacher by day and a rogue crafter by night. Lisa, unable to find employment since losing her job in 2009, has been working on making Erin.Lane her means of support, with the hope that one day Lindsey can quit teaching to help her sew full time.  Together we are the Erin.Lane Organizational Superheroes. 


We are a mother and daughter team who are working to rid the knitting world of cluttered, disorganized tools. It started as a weekend project when Lindsey was losing more needles than she could afford.  Mom was always handy with a sewing machine, so we went to work.  After several attempts, we developed something to hold knitting needles neatly and safely. (To see how far we have come, you can get the full story here.) Soon people were frequently asking for KnitPacks, as they were dubbed.  Erin.Lane was born.  We quickly realized that people also like knitting bags, and developed new bags to meet the real needs of real crafters.  We developed our canvas "Bucket" bag which needed some jazzing up.  With limited funds, we found a used embroidery machine on E-bay and started the whirlwind of embroidering insanity.  Because she is used and shipped and not top of the line, she has many limitations.  


The Impact

With a new embroidery machine, Erin.Lane would be able to make the world a more beautiful and organized place for fiber enthusiasts the world over.  Our most popular product, the "Bucket" needs the assistance of embroidery.  The new embroidery machine will work faster and with a higher stitch quality and allow us to continue offering the embroidered bucket.  Also, with the new machine, we will be able to offer monogrammed buckets to the fiber world as well.  Our current machine does not cut "jumps" (the threads that go from letter to letter).  This means that we sit at night and cut these jumps by hand for hours at a time.  The new machine will greatly reduce this process as the software running this machine works to avoid excessive "jumps."



Furthermore, we will be able to embroider a larger area with the new machine.  Where our current machine will only use a 4 X 6 hoop and a 5 X 7 hoop.  The Brother 2800-D can embroider up to a 6 X 10 space and can use up to 6 different size hoops.  It comes with  4 X 4, 5 X 7, and 6 X 10 inch hoops.


Isn't she pretty?...


If we are unable to raise the funds, our current embroidery machine is unlikely to survive the holiday rush.  She will most likely pass out from the volume of work required.  Without the canvas bucket, the fiber crafters of the world will miss out on a unique tool for the organization of their craft.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $4,500.  This will cover the cost of the machine and the Embroidery Software to allow us to personalize the bags. 

This machine generally retails at $5,000 plus the $350 for the software. However, we have found the Brother 2800-D at two LOCAL small businesses in our area who have offered to help.  They have quoted us $4,300 for the machine, which is a huge deal especially because these shops are also offering us free training to make sure we get the most out of the machine and her features.

If we do not reach the full goal, we are hoping to make enough money at our next show, Stitches Midwest, to cover the short fall. If we do not make at least half of our goal, we will have to bank the money and save until the goal can be reached. 

Check the list to the right for full details, but here are some of the things you could get for your donation.
  • a public shout out on Facebook and Twitter
  • Large Drawstring Project Bag
  • A KnitPack Ultimate
  • 2 FULLY CUSTOMIZED buckets
  • an entire set of Erin.Lane goodies
  • 15 % off FOR LIFE!
  • a trip to a STITCHES 2012 (this has a bunch of goodies with it)


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out.  Tell all your friends at your knitting group, or if you are at home, help people connect thought Facebook or Twitter.  Please write about it in your blogs and tell anyone who suffers from fiber disorganization.  


You can also find us on Ravelry and on our website.
story_txt:
Our Story
Lindsey is an 8th grade grammar teacher by day and a rogue crafter by night. Lisa, unable to find employment since losing her job in 2009, has been working on making Erin.Lane her means of support, with the hope that one day Lindsey can quit teaching to help her sew full time.  Together we are the Erin.Lane Organizational Superheroes. 

We are a mother and daughter team who are working to rid the knitting world of cluttered, disorganized tools. It started as a weekend project when Lindsey was losing more needles than she could afford.  Mom was always handy with a sewing machine, so we went to work.  After several attempts, we developed something to hold knitting needles neatly and safely. (To see how far we have come, you can get the full story here.) Soon people were frequently asking for KnitPacks, as they were dubbed.  Erin.Lane was born.  We quickly realized that people also like knitting bags, and developed new bags to meet the real needs of real crafters.  We developed our canvas "Bucket" bag which needed some jazzing up.  With limited funds, we found a used embroidery machine on E-bay and started the whirlwind of embroidering insanity.  Because she is used and shipped and not top of the line, she has many limitations.  


The Impact
With a new embroidery machine, Erin.Lane would be able to make the world a more beautiful and organized place for fiber enthusiasts the world over.  Our most popular product, the "Bucket" needs the assistance of embroidery.  The new embroidery machine will work faster and with a higher stitch quality and allow us to continue offering the embroidered bucket.  Also, with the new machine, we will be able to offer monogrammed buckets to the fiber world as well.  Our current machine does not cut "jumps" (the threads that go from letter to letter).  This means that we sit at night and cut these jumps by hand for hours at a time.  The new machine will greatly reduce this process as the software running this machine works to avoid excessive "jumps."


Furthermore, we will be able to embroider a larger area with the new machine.  Where our current machine will only use a 4 X 6 hoop and a 5 X 7 hoop.  The Brother 2800-D can embroider up to a 6 X 10 space and can use up to 6 different size hoops.  It comes with  4 X 4, 5 X 7, and 6 X 10 inch hoops.

Isn't she pretty?...

If we are unable to raise the funds, our current embroidery machine is unlikely to survive the holiday rush.  She will most likely pass out from the volume of work required.  Without the canvas bucket, the fiber crafters of the world will miss out on a unique tool for the organization of their craft.


What We Need & What You Get
We need $4,500.  This will cover the cost of the machine and the Embroidery Software to allow us to personalize the bags. 

This machine generally retails at $5,000 plus the $350 for the software. However, we have found the Brother 2800-D at two LOCAL small businesses in our area who have offered to help.  They have quoted us $4,300 for the machine, which is a huge deal especially because these shops are also offering us free training to make sure we get the most out of the machine and her features.

If we do not reach the full goal, we are hoping to make enough money at our next show, Stitches Midwest, to cover the short fall. If we do not make at least half of our goal, we will have to bank the money and save until the goal can be reached. 

Check the list to the right for full details, but here are some of the things you could get for your donation.

a public shout out on Facebook and Twitter
Large Drawstring Project Bag
A KnitPack Ultimate
2 FULLY CUSTOMIZED buckets
an entire set of Erin.Lane goodies
15 % off FOR LIFE!
a trip to a STITCHES 2012 (this has a bunch of goodies with it)



Other Ways You Can Help
Help us get the word out.  Tell all your friends at your knitting group, or if you are at home, help people connect thought Facebook or Twitter.  Please write about it in your blogs and tell anyone who suffers from fiber disorganization.  

You can also find us on Ravelry and on our website.

story:
We are now Shipping!!!

 

Introducing Harperwoods

Since the time shoes have been made, options are presented to us season after season. However, there is no way to get shoes as per our need or desire. Shoes that we wear are made in thousands and we are made to pick the best compromise from these options.  What we don't have, is a way to truly personalize our shoes.

Presenting Harperwoods: Now create a perfect shoe in matter of few minutes.

Harperwoods shoe is one's own personal statement of luxury & style.  

SHOES DESIGNED BY OUR PIONEER BACKERS

 

 

 

 

With Harperwoods' Virtual Design Studio, shoe becomes your canvas

Harperwoods Design Studio lets you define the design, materials & colors based on your usage and requirement. Kiss goodbye to compromise.

 

Harperwoods makes it simple for you to design & configure the shoe for colors, materials & styles.

Few Shoes Designed by our Backers

 

Shape Options

Our canvas enables you to build over 7 billion combinations. First time in the world we have so much flexibility and options.

Leather & Color Options

 

At launch we are offering 20 colors in 2 material options. This apart we have 8 options for soles. As we progress through the campaign, you'll be able to unlock more shapes, Materials as well as colors through stretch goals.

We have an exciting range of materials and design options planned ahead. You would have unique shapes, designs as well as quite a few exclusive &  limited editions. 

 

Harperwoods Design Studio also gives you the power to personalize your shoes.

Make your shoe truly just your's. Just put your own name or design on your shoes.

Our high quality shoes are backed by an equally awesome warranty.

 

RISK & REWARDS

We are committed to bring to you infinite choices of personalization.  We have developed the studio and have got our manufacturing and logistics bases covered. 

We need your help to continuously commission new shapes & materials. Our workshop is already making the first batch of shoes, which shall start shipping out in next few weeks.

Grab your Harperwoods now only on Indiegogo and be part of our exclusive Founders club

Pioneers are all up & taken. You can choose to be a Daredevil or Adventurous. Never again shall there be an entry into these clubs. 

All members of founders club hold a special place in our hearts. Special limited editions, materials and prices shall be first offered to you. As part of founders club, you shall also have bearing on the direction we take.

 

HARPERWOODS VOYAGE

 

Shoes seem small & simple. Creating the ecosystem has not been easy. Though we have been part of footwear industry for nearly 3 decades, it has not been as simple as we had envisaged. It has taken us more than 18 months to put all things in place. Our studio is up & running. The first set of Harperwoods shoes shall be with our Backers in next few weeks.

Once, you finalize the design, our master craftsmen cut each component by hand, choosing the best part of the leather for each piece. The components are manually dyed to render the unique coloration, which are then stitched together and carefully hand lasted to make the shoe. Final finish is the result of careful hand painting, burnishing,and hand buffing by expert craftsmen. Each pair is different and made with dedication & love. In the end, each pair is given a thorough inspection to ensure it meets our high-quality standards.

Harperwoods uses innovative processes & disruptive technologies to preserve & present traditional craftsmanship, with a modern outlook.

Direct to Consumer - At Harperwoods, we have removed multiple layers of middlemen and other extraneous expenses to reduce the price to less than a third of what a luxury footwear brand would price their product (of similar quality). So, the freedom to design your own shoe doesn't come at a very heavy cost.

Reduce Wastage with technology - In addition to removing middlemen, our unique manufacturing concept (of marrying the traditional with the technology) helps in reducing wastage of materials and resources. For each pair of branded luxury footwear sold, nearly 3 pairs go to waste and are destroyed to maintain the exclusivity and price. And guess who pays for this wastage – YOU!!

We believe luxury and choice should not cost a fortune. At Harperwoods providing luxury shoes at true prices is the start of a movement which provides its patrons with value and satisfaction.

-40% less shoes would have to made.

GRAB your Harperwoods shoe now. Not only you get your shoe at steal away prices, you also become part of an exclusive Founders Club, which shall come with lifelong exclusive benefits.

 

A society is built on the foundations of generosity & trust. True growth is possible only when an organization works to enrich the lives of the people it works with. For every pair of Harperwoods shoes that is sold, we donate a pair of school shoes to impoverished school children.By making shoes on demand, natural resources are not wasted. This contributes towards saving of the environment & precious natural resources in a small but significant way.

 

Shoes that we have shipped

story:
If you would like to purchase a Bean About please head over to our offical website:

www.mybeanabout.com

 

 

 

 

Sharing is caring!

If you like what we're doing? Please share Bean About with your friends and family on:

Facebook /// Instagram /// Twitter

For PRESS INQUIRIES please contact: vanessa@mybeanabout.com

Click here for Press Kit images and write ups.

 

The Bean About is the evolution of the good old beanbag. It’s as comfortable & supportive as a full size beanbag, and with its clever, original design, it’s as portable as a backpack!

BEAN ABOUT ™ | The foldable beanbag that goes anywhere!

 

 

 

 

 

 

To begin with we will offer 2 adult and 3 creative kids designs made from durable, waterproof, polyester. The kid’s bags are 7% smaller in size and a custom fit for little ones as young as 3.

Our kid’s bags are extra special because they represent 3 critically endangered species... the Tiger, Mountain Gorilla and Rock Wallaby. Through your support we will be making quarterly donations to 3 front line organisations fighting to preserve these amazing creatures:

  • TRAFFIC
  • Virunga National Park and
  • The Australian Wildlife Conservancy

We will also be telling their stories and sharing fascinating facts about these animals on our website and blog to bring awareness to their situation.

In addition to conservation, we love the diversity and expression of art and have commissioned the amazing Mulga the Artist to design the Mountain Gorilla bag, featuring Julio the Tree Hugger. This focus on art and conservation will be something we continue over time by promoting artists and worthy causes. Not only do we want to be comfortable in our world. We want a better world to be comfortable in. 

 

Watch Mulga the Artist in action and see his illustration come to life!

Andy and I love the supreme comfort of the iconic beanbag and after one too many kids’ parties, uncomfortably standing about or sitting in the grass we thought... Wouldn't it be great to have a small, foldable beanbag that you could take anywhere!

 

Up until then, we, like most people, considered the Beanbag to be a predominantly large, static indoor piece of furniture. We loved it, but it just wasn’t practical to take anywhere we wanted to. 

We felt the Beanbag should and could evolve into something that would better suit our family’s active outdoor lifestyle. So we set out to create: 

  • A beanbag that was compact enough to be folded 
  • One with an innovative design that allowed it to be carried anywhere easily
  • While retaining the iconic cozy comfort of the classic Beanbag 

That started us on this journey. We have been planning strategies, drawing designs, testing fabrics, and relaxing in prototypes for the past three years, and we’re just getting going. 

This journey has been made easier through working with some of the most talented textile professionals in Sydney. The careful craftsmanship and skill of these women has been instrumental in making this unique product look and feel fantastic. 

 

 

 

 

Designing the Bean About

We knew that supporting the spine was the most important thing when it came to designing the Bean About, but we also wanted to retain enough wrap around comfort to keep it cozy. 

Finding just the right amount of beans to keep the Bean About compact yet iconic was a matter of fine-tuning. It’s unique design allows for a minimum amount of beans. In-fact, we use LESS THAN HALF of an average adult sized beanbag. This makes it light enough for kids, compact enough to be folded, and easier to carry, while minimizing the impact on the environment. 

Then we added straps to the back of the bag for portability, 2 pockets on the outside to secure valuables, and 3 more pockets on the inside for a drink, some snacks, and anything else one might need while relaxing at the park or on the beach.

Using bean distribution the Bean About operates best when it’s just over half full so that it can be folded. Then due to weight distribution the Bean About feels completely full when you're seated! 

 

 

 

 

 

The bag is deployed by unhooking the wooden toggle and shaking the beans down to the pointed back rest end.

----------------------------------------------------

 

 

Once the beans are there just flip the bag onto the ground like laying a picnic blanket out. This will contain the beans firmly into the backrest area.

----------------------------------------------------

 

 

Then give the Beans a little pat around the centre of the bag to move some down towards your bottom area before taking a seat.

----------------------------------------------------

 

When you’re ready to go, just shake the beans back to the blunt end, lay the bag on the ground and fasten the toggle. It’s that easy.

----------------------------------------------------


 

 

 

There are so many ways you can sit or lay on your Bean About. Upright for conversations at a picnic or lounging low to take a nap or read a book. Just adjust your beans to the way you like it.

 

"Our Bean About goes from the kids footy to picnics to the beach to the balcony. We store it in the car so there's always a comfy seat on hand. Wouldn't be without it! "

Rachel Rodd, Bondi Junction, NSW, Australia.

"As a pretty big guy (over 2 meters and 110 kgs), it can be difficult to find comfortable seating to take with me when I go to the park or the beach. Not only did I find the Bean About easy to carry, it supported my back no matter where I was, which made it super comfortable to sit or lounge in."

Olatundji Akpo-Sani, Tamarama, NSW, Australia.

 

 

YOUR BEANS

Each adult Bean About should hold approximately 71 mls of polystyrene beans. Polystyrene beans come in bags of 100 ml so keep the left over beans to top up your Bean About occasionally. There is NEVER any need to throw your beans away as a topped up bag is just as comfortable as a newly filled one! Keep your beans and reuse them over and over again.

FILLING YOUR BAG

When filling, slow down just over the halfway point then test the foldability. If it’s easily folded, then fill a little more. It’s perfect just before the point where you can no longer fold and fasten.

LOOKING AFTER YOUR BAG

The Bean About is a spot wash outdoor product, so if you get the occasional mud or grass stain on it, just get some hot soapy water and sponge the area down to remove the stain before hanging it outside to dry on a sunny day.

 

 

Risks and challenges

The Bean About is at the final sample stage. We are ensuring the product is just right and made to our high quality standards. This process is going well, and we are working with an international partner to ensure everything is done competently and correctly.

Our products still need to go through final compliance testing to ensure international compliance and safety standards are met. This takes around 2 weeks and could hold things up slightly if something needs to be changed. However, after a lot of research and advice on our product design, we have not been forewarned of any problems and continually ensure that all of our components are tried and tested.
