story:
Crazy Cowboy Company’s line of successful “Buck U” merchandise is going to the next level with their solid brass trophy belt buckle — Midnight Rodeo belt buckles.  CCC is raising capital for production and for marketing and advertising.

Short Summary 

Luke Mickelson traces both sides of his family back to they days when Wyoming was a U.S. Territory. Businessmen, a sheriff and even an outlaw — they’re all in his family tree. He grew up around ranches, worked his share of cattle, got bucked off his share of horses and more than a few bulls too. So, yes, you could say he knows the difference between a rank horse and a stick horse or real cowboy wear from wanna-be cowboy stuff.

Roger Carpenter moved "west" in 2003 after 30 years in Los Angeles where he designed many of the movie posters that hung in all our teenage bedrooms — Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, Risky Business and Planet of the Apes — not to mention those memorable Levi jean ads which created a generation of urban cowboys.

These two teamed up to create Crazy Cowboy Company in, where else, Laramie, Wyoming.

Last year, Luke (shown above wearing his "Buck U" T-shirt) and Roger raised capital, secured copyright protection, and created an e-com store to produce Crazy Cowboy apparel for men, women and children under the "Buck U," "Crazy Cowboy Company," and "Lil' Bucker" labels. Their Facebook friends have grown from a few family members to over 500 in just a few months.

Success with T-shirts, sweatshirts and caps is relatively affordable. But, understanding that a trophy belt buckle is to a cowboy what a gold medal is to an Olympic athlete, we sure didn’t want to make a "bottle cap" lightweight piece of stamped metal. We had to do it right or not at all.

Roger collaborated with world-renowned type designer Peter Greco to create the artwork before talking to Western Heritage Foundry in Loveland, Colorado where they've been making belt buckles for The US Forest Service for over 25 years. The artisans there hand sculpted the die to match the artwork shown above, then cast the prototype using the same techniques they learned from their daddies and granddaddies. You can see for your self that the result is worth the effort and expense.

NUMBER ONE: We wanted to create something extraordinary — the best trophy belt buckle in the world and we believe we did! 

Now it's our greatest wish that all these young cowboys purchase our belt buckles. But it doesn't stop there. It’s CCC’s goal to be a part of making a difference in the rodeo community. Your contribution helps us create the beginning of a more profitable extension of our business, giving us the potential to collaborate on support programs designed specifically to help bull riders.

What We Need & What You Get

We’re asking for $100,000 to create “Midnight Rodeo” belt buckles for men. So far Roger and Luke have spent just under $10,000 to produce the buckle prototype and that fabulous video you just watched. Quality work doesn’t come cheap.  

We will effectively use $50,000 for the initial casting set-up, limited production and packaging of the first production run of solid brass belt buckles plus a smaller run of gold and silver buckles offered as a premium for higher contribution gifts.

We anticipate using another $50,000 to offset advertising, promotion and some operating expenses— all that it will take to get these belt buckles in the hands of all those cowboys who want to sport our Midnight Cowboy style, no matter whether they ride horses or bulls or just drive their trucks to work!

Combined, that’s $100,000 to help us get us through the launch of Midnight Rodeo.

You can contribute to helping Crazy Cowboy Company ride this family of Midnight Cowboy belt buckles into the arena by giving at one of the eleven different levels shown. Please indicate the size that best fits you and the color/s you like. We'll do our best to make sure we get you what you ordered but supplies are limited.

The Impact

We’ve been all across the great state of Wyoming from Jackson to Cheyenne and back to Laramie. Everyone who knows Crazy Cowboy Company and “Buck U” tells us that we’ve got a runaway hit with “Midnight Rodeo.”

Luke has been stopped more than once and asked to sell his “Buck U” T-shirt off his back. One girl even followed him home saying she’d do “anything” to get his shirt. The young cowboys who have seen our prototype “Midnight Rodeo” belt buckle are on a waiting list to buy it.So it’s only a matter of having the capital to launch the product, to build the 'must have' brand for all those cowboys out there — real and 'wanna be'.  Your help will make the difference, and you could be the first in your circle of friends to wear the Midnight Rodeo buckle.

And we don't want it to stop at Crazy Cowboy Company. The successful launch of the line enables a more profitable extension of the CCC business, thereby helping our company to support programs designed specifically to help bull riders.

Other Ways You Can Help

Almost everyone knows at least 10 other people who have a few extra dollars to spare. Send ‘em an email about the Midnight Rodeo Project. You might even give them an old fashioned phone call. You can also direct your friends and business associates to us using the Indegogo SHARE TOOLS.
story_txt:
Crazy Cowboy Company’s line of successful “Buck U” merchandise is going to the next level with their solid brass trophy belt buckle — Midnight Rodeo belt buckles.  CCC is raising capital for production and for marketing and advertising.

Short Summary 

Luke Mickelson traces both sides of his family
back to they days when Wyoming was a U.S. Territory. Businessmen, a sheriff and even an
outlaw — they’re all in his family tree. He grew up around ranches,
worked his share of cattle, got bucked off his share of horses and more than a few
bulls too. So, yes, you could say he knows the difference between a rank horse
and a stick horse or real cowboy wear from wanna-be cowboy stuff.
Roger Carpenter moved "west" in 2003 after 30 years
in Los Angeles where he designed many of the movie posters that hung in all our
teenage bedrooms — Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, Risky Business and
Planet of the Apes — not to mention those memorable Levi jean ads which created
a generation of urban cowboys.
These two teamed up to create Crazy Cowboy
Company in, where else, Laramie, Wyoming.


Last year, Luke (shown above wearing his "Buck U" T-shirt) and Roger raised capital, secured copyright protection, and created an e-com store to produce Crazy Cowboy apparel for men, women and children under the "Buck U," "Crazy Cowboy Company," and "Lil' Bucker" labels. Their Facebook friends have grown from a few family members to over 500 in just a few months.
Success with T-shirts, sweatshirts and caps is
relatively affordable. But, understanding that a trophy belt buckle is to a cowboy what a gold
medal is to an Olympic athlete, we sure didn’t want to make a "bottle cap" lightweight
piece of stamped metal. We had to do it right or not at all.
Roger collaborated with world-renowned type
designer Peter Greco to create the artwork before talking to Western Heritage Foundry in Loveland, Colorado where they've been making belt buckles for The US Forest Service for over 25 years. The
artisans there hand sculpted the die to match the artwork shown above, then cast the prototype using the same techniques they learned from their
daddies and granddaddies. You can see for your self that the result is worth the
effort and expense.


NUMBER ONE: We wanted to create something
extraordinary — the best trophy belt buckle in the world and we believe we did! 
Now it's our greatest wish that all these young cowboys purchase our belt buckles. But it doesn't stop there. It’s CCC’s goal to be a part of making a
difference in the rodeo community. Your contribution helps us create the beginning of a more
profitable extension of our business, giving us the
potential to collaborate on support programs designed specifically to help
bull riders.
What We Need & What
You Get
We’re asking for $100,000 to create “Midnight
Rodeo” belt buckles for men. So far Roger and Luke have spent just under
$10,000 to produce the buckle prototype and that fabulous video you just
watched. Quality work doesn’t come cheap.  
We will effectively use $50,000 for the initial casting set-up, limited production and packaging of the first production run of solid brass
belt buckles plus a smaller run of gold and silver buckles offered as a
premium for higher contribution gifts.
We anticipate using another $50,000 to offset
advertising, promotion and some operating expenses— all that it will take
to get these belt buckles in the hands of all those cowboys who want to sport
our Midnight Cowboy style, no matter whether they ride horses or bulls or just
drive their trucks to work!
Combined, that’s $100,000 to help us get us
through the launch of Midnight Rodeo.
You can contribute to helping Crazy Cowboy
Company ride this family of Midnight Cowboy belt buckles into the arena by giving at one of the eleven different levels shown. Please indicate the size that best fits you and the color/s you like. We'll do our best to make sure we get you what you ordered but supplies are limited.


The Impact
We’ve been all across the great state of Wyoming
from Jackson to Cheyenne and back to Laramie. Everyone who knows Crazy Cowboy
Company and “Buck U” tells us that we’ve got a runaway hit with “Midnight
Rodeo.”
Luke has been stopped more than once and asked to
sell his “Buck U” T-shirt off his back. One girl even followed him home saying
she’d do “anything” to get his shirt. The young cowboys who have seen our
prototype “Midnight Rodeo” belt buckle are on a waiting list to buy it.So it’s only a matter of having the capital to
launch the product, to build the 'must have' brand for all those cowboys out
there — real and 'wanna be'.  Your help will make the difference, and you
could be the first in your circle of friends to wear the Midnight Rodeo buckle.

And we don't want it to stop at Crazy Cowboy
Company. The successful launch of the line enables a more profitable extension
of the CCC business, thereby helping our company to support programs designed
specifically to help bull riders.
Other Ways You Can Help
Almost everyone knows at least 10 other people who have a few extra dollars to spare. Send ‘em an
email about the Midnight Rodeo Project. You might even give them an
old fashioned phone call. You can also direct your friends and business
associates to us using the Indegogo SHARE TOOLS.

story:
Heat Reaction T-shirts from Liquid Screen Design!

At Liquid Screen Design we are on the cutting edge of t-shirt technology!  We have pioneered custom lazer t-shirts, glow in the dark printing, UV color change and now Heat Reaction t-shirts!

**PROJECT**

Heat Reaction t-shirts are regular t-shirts that are treated with a chemical process that makes them react to temperature.  We have already figured out the process (see our Indiegogo project video or the videos on the gallery page), but we need to make the process more affordable.  This is where you come in!  We need your help so we can take Heat Reaction shirts to the masses.

**INSPIRATION**

For our very first project on Indiegogo, we wanted to bring forward a one-of-its-kind product. Everybody has a closet full of t-shirts.  You get a t-shirt at a charity walk.  You get one when you join a fraternity or sorority.  You even get a t-shirt when you sign up for a credit card.  We wanted to come up with a unique t-shirt that you’ve probably never seen before.  That’s why we’re bringing you the Heat Reaction t-shirt. 

We think that you will love these amazing t-shirts.  Over the past year as we've tested the technology and worked out the kinks, the reaction to these t-shirts has been nothing less than mind-blowing.  Everyone wants to know how to get these color-changing t-shirts for themselves.  We are ready to bring these to market, but need assistance in making them available to everyone.

**F.A.Q.**

Q.  How do you wash these t-shirts?
A.  Same as any other clothing - regular wash cycle, dry on low heat.  Low heat when drying is important to preserve the heat reactive qualities of the shirt.

Q.  What if I live outside of North America?  Can I still get a Heat Reaction t-shirt?
A.  Right now on Indiegogo, we are not able to offer international shipping.  Hopefully in the future, we'll be able to do this.

Q.  I have another question.  What should I do? 
A.  Contact us through Indiegogo.  We will get back to you promptly and answer any questions.

**HEAT REACTION IN ACTION**

Click on the "Gallery" tab above to see more images and videos of our Heat Reaction t-shirts!

story:
Dwibit simplifies the shopping experience by combining exclusive services, inspirational editorial content and real time social integration to create a fun and highly personalized shopping experience. Dwibit puts the customer in control by leveraging collective buying power via the Dwibit Personal Shopper to get deals on the items that our customers want most. 

 

The Dwibit "Engine” is a predictive behavioral merchandising algorithm that learns and builds robust customer profiles by collecting data at various stages of the shopping lifecycle across five seamlessly integrated Dwibit products. This gives us deeper insight into our customer’s buying motivations allowing us to deliver more relevant and desirable product solutions across all of our shopping services.

  

Have you ever found an item you really wanted but were willing to wait to buy it once it goes on sale? The Dwibit Personal Shopper is a digital shopping service (SAAS) that eliminates the need to keep checking back on the items you want most by automatically alerting you when those items go on sale, are in-stock or available in a new color.

The best part is it also leverages collective buying power to get you the best price possible while serving up similar products that match in brand proximity, style, color and price.

 

Deeper Discounts

When a Personal Shopper request is created our team of professional buyers work hard to negotiate for the lowest price possible on both full price and already reduced items. We can’t guarantee how low the prices will go, but that’s where collective buying power kicks in and deeper discounts turn into welcomed surprises.

 

Preferred Treatment. Pre-Sale Shopping.

As Personal Shopper requests get filled, users have an exclusive opportunity to purchase items before they become available to the rest of our customers.  It’s like being first in line for new lowered prices and restocked sold-out items.

 

Hassle Free. 

Sit back, enjoy life and receive priority notifications via email or SMS while our experts and product-match technology find the exact and similar products for you to review. Welcome to the luxuries of having a personal shopper work 24 hours a day 365 days a year just for you.

 

Never Pay a Dime.  Earning Free PS Credits is easy

Personal Shopper credits cost $1 per credit and each request cost 5 credits. That’s like spending $5 to save $100 on new pair of Madden boots. But why fork over hard earned cash when you can use the service for free? The more you use Dwibit.com the more free credits you can earn. Check out our perks to load up on Personal Shopper credits today!

  

Styleboards bring together Dwibit articles and deep discounts to bridge the gap between great ideas and incredible finds. Users can group all their faves into Styleboards to stay organized or to create unique trends. Post Styleboards to Facebook, Twitter and Pinterest to share deals, spark new conversations and inspire your friends.

 

Dwibit Sales are exclusive limited-time events curetted by Dwibit® style experts.  Containing everything from eclectic boutique treasures to discounted premium brands. Sales are a goldmine for those with a taste for luxury and the savvy to save.

 

Dwibit Shops are an eclectic mix of the brands you already love and unique one-of-a-kind treasures. Shops are perfect for finding unique flair or for those who crave the latest in design, style, innovation and quality.

Dwibit® Articles keep you on your toes and in-the-know, while surveys and polls measure up our users perspectives on trending topic, gossip, know-how and news.

 

Thank you for your interest in Dwibit!  I am a strategic digital & creative leader with a passion for using technology, communication and design as building blocks to create cutting edge multi-channel experiences that transform the way people communicate, shop and live today.

I have spent 12 years leading creative & technology teams for Fortune 100 retailers building e-commerce, tablet and mobile experiences. My work spans a variety of channels & industries for market-leading organizations and nationally recognized brands including Sears, Walgreens, Sports Authority, Home Depot, Kenmore, L’Oréal, Maybelline and McDonald’s.  I have built digital products like this many times before but this time is very different.

Working on customer experience teams, I have always been an advocate for the consumer. Quite frequently I found myself sitting in rooms full of executive management where everyone was talking about ways to get customers to buy product based on business objectives or poorly forecasted excess inventory.

I wanted to create a business model that wasn’t based on pushing unwanted products onto customers, but rather pull in customer’s requests and provide back products they truly want and thus the concept for Dwibit was born. 

Why Indegogo?

My team and i have poured our hearts, souls, and a chunk of money into this business. And after 14 months of planning, design and development, we are only a few months away from launching. We have completed the functionality requirements, the entire design and started on development. 

Entrepreneurship can be a very challenging long and lonely endeavor. Creating a crowd of believers via Indiegogo is vital to our success moving forward. You are not just supporting a cool project - you’re helping to establish a sustainable scalable business. If you cannot make a financial contribution please show your support by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. 

100% of Your contribution will help fund:

• Brand proximity matching via the Personal Shopper
• Advanced Styleboard integration with Pinterest.
• Intelligent behavior algorithm and recommendation engine
• Integrated loyalty system redeemable for free services and swag.

 

Thank you for your support!

 

Win FREE VIP Packages!

We are giving away 10 FREE VIP packages! Checkout the Dwibit Referral Competition to learn how you can win!

 

Questions, Comments, Ideas?

We want to hear from you. Email us at mail@dwibit.com with any questions.
